message: Fixed use of it after free.
Onion test fixed to work with faster DHT.

Increase max file transfer speed.

Fix bug that limited it to 1K packets per second.
Attempted fix of UDP disconnect bug that happens when both ipv4 and ipv6 are connected.

File transfer fixes.

Fixed file transfers disconnecting tox clients from each other in
some network conditions.

Fix PACKET_ID_OFFLINE fallinthrough PACKET_ID_NICKNAME

This fixes the PACKET_ID_OFFLINE handling code incorrectly falling through to the PACKET_ID_NICKNAME handling code

This bug resulted in a friend B's name being wiped on friend A's client after B removes A

Fixes tux3/qTox#1967

Fixes #1426

Fix PACKET_ID_OFFLINE fallinthrough PACKET_ID_NICKNAME

This fixes the PACKET_ID_OFFLINE handling code incorrectly falling through to the PACKET_ID_NICKNAME handling code

This bug resulted in a friend B's name being wiped on friend A's client after B removes A

Fixes tux3/qTox#1967

Fixes #1426
Fixed memory leak during session cleanup and fixed naming.
Fixed Tox reporting itself as being connected with TCP when using UDP only on LAN.
Fixed sample size in callback and other stuff
Fixed rare bug where userstatus, name, etc... would not be sent to friend.
Fixed bug when deleting friend that we are connected to in group chat.
Fixed friends getting disconnected when transferring files.
Fixed* api comments and some bugs

Fixed some non standard C.

Replaced void * with uint8_t * in list.c

Fixed some warnings.

Removed useless include.
Added many test and fixed various warnings
Fixed one case of the connection callback not getting called on reconnection.

Fixed a couple possible issues with the friend connection callback.

A TCP callback could be received when only a UDP connection was present.

Increased a UDP timeout to make it less likely to time out and switch to TCP.

Fixed a case where the tcp_data_callback would get called when the
connection only worked 1 way.

Some fixes and improvements.

Fixed that the first TCP relays in the list would never be disconnected
even if they were useless.
Fixed memory leak in TCP connection.

Fixed offline callback being called when connection timed out and died
without ever actually being connected.

Fixed file transfer bug.

This should have been at the beginning of the loop, not the end.
Fixed group audio issues when getting an old audio packet.

Fixed case where a recv and a sending file would have the same number.

recv file numbers are now (file num in packet + 1) << 16

Code cleanups.

Fixed wrong variable used, removed useless elements of struct.

Fixed possible TCP server bug.

Function returned success when should have returned failure.

Fixed friend_not_valid function.

It now returns if friend is valid or not not only if memory location is
valid.
Fixed header protectors and cleaning up the msi

Fixed bug where mutex would be destroyed but not recreated for new
net_crypto connection.

Only destroy mutex when it is realloced out.

Fixed Windows build
Apparently ERROR was defined as some constant somewhere on Windows.

Code cleanups.

Moved some functions to onion.c.

Fixed possible portability issues.
Fixed bug with auto tests and cleaned up the code a bit.

Fixed bug.

Set friend in onion as offline when friend goes offline.

Fixed bug in tox_load where names of size TOX_MAX_NAME_LENGTH didn't
load.

Fixed some A/V threading issues.

Audio dropping on video calls issue should no longer happen.

Fixed video packet assembling.

Video should look better now.
Fixed crash when connection was killed during the packet callback.
Fixed possible issue with wrong size being passed to opus_decode().

Fixed bug where group chat would see connection as offline when it was online.

Clarified something in the docs.

Fixed bug where video didn't work anymore.

Some other cleanups.
Fixed integer rollover bug in toxav.
Fixed small issue where group audio would jumble up sometimes at start of stream.
Fixed some threading related issues in toxcore.
Fixed groupchat bug that caused peers to not connect to each other.
Fixed some audio group chat issues.
Enable IPv6, fix systemd PID bug

Fixed group peer chosing algorithm.

Groups should be much more stable.

Fixed group bugs.

Connections should now die when appropriate instead of lingering
endlessly.

Some fixes to avatar pull request.

Some bug fixes.

Grouped all avatar related functions in the same place in tox.h

Added tests for custom lossy and lossless packets.

Fixed bug with lossless packets.

Updated docs.

Fixed possible issue in last commit.

Fixed iOS possible SIGPIPE issue.

Apparently on iOS UDP sockets can SIGPIPE (what the fuck apple?).
Fixed bug that led to increased bandwidth usage.
Disable decode deadline, fixed build error.

Fixed possible threading issues.

send_lossy_cryptpacket() can get called from another thread meaning
the connection can be killed while the packet is sending.

Fixed some issues with queue.

disconnecting then reconnecting right away should no longer kill
audio transmission.

Rewrote audio packet queue.

Audio killing itself after 20 minutes in a call should be fixed.

Fixed bug where two Tox clients sometimes didn't reconnect right
after disconnecting due to them getting stuck in a connection loop.
Set some functions as static, fixed warning.
Fixed possible bug with TCP nonce not getting incremented.

Fixed TCP bug.

Packet was being copied with a wrong, smaller length.

Fixed bug with TCP.

Don't increment nonce if packet was discarded instead of being sent.
Fixed threading bug that could cause segfaults.
Fixed possible out of bounds read.

Fixed segfault and other possible bugs in msi.c

toxav should no longer have weird behaviour when a dead call times out.
Fixed msi_session being used after being freed.

The width and height set during the video encoder initialization is
now described as the maximum width and height of images.

This is to work around what appears to be a bug in libvpx where the
resolution of the stream can be decreased but increasing it above
its originally set value introduces memory corruption.
Fixed bug when loading friends list already containing an added friend.

Fixed out of bounds read.

payload_type seems to be completely useless and should be removed.
Removed redundant code and fixed toxav codec actions being called when call inactive

Fixed video in call sometimes freezing.

This should not happen anymore.
Fixed tox_do_interval() returning value so high it broke A/V.
Fixed calling msi_reject more than once possibly causing issues.
Fixed possible bug if more than one ringing msi packet was sent to us.

Fixed segfault that happened because calls could be hanged up more
than once.
Fixed some more possible issues with file transfers/conjestion control.

Fixed video bitrate being set way higher than it should.

Video bitrate is set in kb/s not b/s.
Fixed possible issues with list introduced in the last commit.
Fixed a case when public key contained null bytes
Fixed bug when adjusting queue size
The comments say this function only returns -1 on error, fixed that.

Fixed some issues in toxdns and added a test.

Added request_id.

request_id must be obtained with tox_generate_dns3_string, stored,
then passed to tox_decrypt_dns3_TXT when we want to decrypt the
received response.

Fixed typo.

This typo doesn't seem to cause any issue because according to the
code in vanilla NaCl the first crypto_box_ZEROBYTES (for encryption)
and crypto_box_BOXZEROBYTES (for decryption) of the array passed to
the crypto_box*() functions don't need to be zero for it to work.

The documentation however clearly states that they need to be zero
which means they need to be zero.

pthread is now a core dependency instead of just a toxav dependency.

Fixed possible thread bug with sending A/V packets.

TODO: eventually make toxcore thread safe.

Fixed segfault when logging was enabled.

m->chats[c] can be NULL if more than one group chat is created and
one of the first ones is deleted.

Fixed regression that made packet_send_rate increase even when
no data was transmitted.
Fixed bug when passing invalid call index

Fixed TOX_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH define.

Removed some useless code from toxcore.

Astyled core code with new version of astyle.

Fixed typo.

This typo doesn't actually cause any side effects unless you are like
stqism and have a C library that doesn't have mempcpy().
Fixed byte order and removed log functions from misc_tools

Fixed tox_get_num_online_friends function.

Removed useless code.

Fixed an issue in list.

Cleaned up TCP server a bit.

Changed lossy packet function names to better ones.

Fixed rtp checking the wrong return value for one.
Fixed nodes never being marked as used

Fixed a bug where someone could just send back the ping request packet
with only the first byte set to 1 instead of 0 and the public key set
to the one of the reciever as a valid response packet.

This breaks network compatibility with all previous cores.

Fixed bug in TCP server where memory was expected to be zero but
sometimes wasn't.
Fixed TCP_client connections not timing out correctly.

Fixed some issues in TCP_server.

Timed out connections now remove themselves correctly.

If a peer with the same public key as another tries to connect,
the old connection is killed.
Fixed possibility that packet_send_rate would get stuck.

Fixed TCP_test.

TCP_test now tests set_tcp_connection_number.

Fixed some issues.

Friends with multiple ips (on LAN) should be handled better.

Remade the function to check the crypto connection status.
Fixed issue where callbacks were not set for accepted connection.

Fixed small issues.

Added set_buffer_end().

File transfer test now checks if pieces arrive correctly.
Fixed major denial of service issue.

Fixed bug.

memcmp is easy to confuse visually with memcpy but they do very different
things.

It was also comparing (copying) the senders real public key with their DHT
public key.

Move the handshake creating code to a function.

Fixed another instance where it was not sent.
Fixed one case of the handshake not being sent.

Fixed minor issue.

Socket used to find the broadcast ip was not closed when there was
more than 16 broadcast interfaces.

Properly deallocate friends' status messages in kill_messenger

Lightly tested. I'm not sure whether this creates a double-free
bug

Updated some files so that they could build with latest core.

Fixed some issues.

Major cleanups.

Fixed circular dependency between DHT and net_crypto: DHT no longer
depends on net_crypto.

Moved the crypto request packets functions to crypto core and DHT.

Cleaned up/added some defines that can be used to get the true maximum
length of things like the friends request message.

MAX_DATA_SIZE has been replaced in most places by more appropriate defines.

Fixed a test.

Removed function from Messenger.h
Fixed possible buffer overflow in function to send friend requests.

DHT_bootstrap.c now has TCP server functionality enabled.

Fixed a regression (same type as last commit).
Fixed regression, announce responses can contain 0 nodes.

Fixed bug where TOX_FAERR_SETNEWNOSPAM would be returned instead of
TOX_FAERR_ALREADYSENT when re adding a confirmed friend.
Fixed issue where other could send a bad userstatus.
Fixed bug, unconfirmed friends now load correctly.
Removed logging to stderr and fixed timeout handling
Fixed clients not connecting when there is only 2 people on the network.
Fixed some possible ways connections could linger indefinitely without being killed.
Fixed several bugs and added some features
Fixed the size function for self status message
Fixed the groupchat bug in a smarter way.
Added better documentation to the api, move some defines, fixed a possible issue.
Fixed user typing bug where it'd alway return an error.
Fixed audio bug and added reason when terminating call

Adjusted some delays.

Decreased LAN discovery packet sending interval.

Attempted fix of the everyone is unknown bug in group chats.
Possibly fixed the issue that group chats would sometimes DOS themselves.
Fixed memory leaks and removed repeated code

Fixed error in last commit.

The tests actually work.
Fixed bug with client_ping_nodes() not pinging any nodes.
Fixed possible anonimity leak with the onion routing.

random_nodes_path should return slightly better paths.

Fixed test in network_test failing on some machines because of localhost
ipv6 issues.
Adjusted some timeouts and fixed possible memory leak.

Incorporated onion into Tox.

Fixed a couple of issues related to that.

Fixed problem in onion_announce.c

Added a way to know if a announce response is valid.

onion_announce seems to be working perfectly.

Stuff added and fixed.
Cleaned up and fixed various things.

get_close_nodes(): make use of assoc to find some really close nodes

DHT.c:
- get_close_nodes(): use assoc to find nodes for the requested reference id
- handle_sendnodes*(): set a proper timestamp for "heard" nodes

assoc.*:
- expand Assoc_close_entries by flags for additional restrictions for search
- Assoc_get_close_entries(): honor the new flags
- new_Assoc() prime handling: min. prime is now 5 instead of 3, and up to 25 is handled directly
- Assoc_status(): added address family for seen/heard, print of hash is now fixed width
Fixed a cuple stylistic bugs. Behaviour should be the same but the code is now proper. Also fixed tox_copy_friendlist.

Fixed small issues.

DHT_test now only prints non zero entries.
Added more printing to DHT_test, fixed typo.

Started as a simple bugfix for wrap(), expanded to more detailed help.

nTox.c:
- flag[]: additional flag for special wrapping
- help expanded and split (to keep below 256 chars)
- new_lines_mark(): stores flag for special wrapping
- print_friendlist():
.  - extracted pattern for output
.  - added length of id string allocation
.  - replaced '\t' with '+ ', wrappers don't account for '\t'
- line_eval():
.  - removed a few do_refresh() directly after a new_lines() (calls do_refresh() at its end)
.  - 'h' (help): parsing of an additional character for f(riend) or g(roup)
- wrap():
.  - the major bugfix:
.    - no more endless looping if the input had a substring with no spaces
.      for more than line_width (e.g. ID of 78 and window smaller than 78)
- wrap_bars(): wrap() for "rich" messages, honors embedded '\n', breaks preferable at '|'
- print_help(): listed all options and added explanations
- print_invite(): fixed minuscule typo
- main(): made print_help() reachable again

nTox.h:
- majorly cut down to what is really needed

Cleaned up some code/fixed some warnings.

I'm sure nobody has any of the old save files anymore so I removed the
functions.
Fixed connection sometimes being too slow and some other possible problems.

sendqueue_length no longer determines if we check for socket-can-write, but sendpacket() sets a timestamp if it happened

network.*:
- sendpacket(): checks result and on EAGAIN, stores time of this event
- networking_wait_prepare(): uses the time if set to check up to 500ms later for the socket to be writeable again
- networking_wait_cleanup(): clears the time if the socket was writeable
- fixed some accidental tabs

Messenger.*, tox.*:
- pass-through functions to reach networking_wait_cleanup()
- fixed some accidental tabs

Broken *_wait() into *_wait_prepare() and *_wait_execute()

To allow the actual waiting to run without any locking, split it into preparing the data it uses and the execution of the wait.
The caller must provide with the buffer to store whatever data it requires to wait.
Completely eliminates any reliance on the existence of anything but that data in the actual wait routine.

Also fixed a few argument type warnings inside LOGGING.
Speeded up/fixed NAT hole punching and peer finding.
Behaviour with LAN ips is now better, also fixed possible bug.

Fixed bug where hole punching was attempted even though the
clients were connected.

Increased the number of ports tried per interval of time.

Also astyled the files.
Possibly fixed the weird disconnecting/reconnecting bug.

Fix bug.

This makes it build on OS X again...
Fixed the connection bug and cleaned up some stuff.

Fixed a bug or two.

Added breaks on the new packet handlers in doFriends for the switch statement, and added a default.

Tests of state loading/saving lead to two fixes for DHT.c and util.c

util.c:
- fix in empty section at the end of the state, showed as bug when having an empty name

DHT.c:
- fix in saving less data than originally announced, showed as bug when not having reached any clients ever (no clients or only with timestamp of zero)

Make test "endtoend" pass on 'slow' systems

auto_test/crypto_test.c:
- test "endtoend": increased timeout from default ~5s to 15s, making it pass on slower systems
- signed/unsiged warning fixed by cast

Fixed portablity problems.

struct in6_addr member names can differ per platform.

DHT peer finding for new friends should now be slightly faster.

Also fixed the "[i] could not send message" bug in nTox.

tox.h, DHT.h:
- tox_bootstrap_ex(), DHT_bootstrap_ex() renamed to tox_bootstrap_from_address(), DHT_bootstrap_from_address()
- (handle_)sendnodes_ex() renamed to (handle_)sendnodes_ipv6()
- only sending sendnodes_ipv6() if we're actually IPv6 enabled
- changed comments to conform better

nTox.c, Messenger_text.c, DHT_test.c, DHT_bootstrap.c:
- fallout from *_ex() to *_from_address()

DHT_bootstrap.c:
- corrected a potentially wrong info message

util.c:
- fixed logfile name: now (funcptr) => now() (number)

network.c:
- addead comment about the necessity of bind() to succeed

auto_test/messenger_test.c:
- defaulting ipv6enabled to TOX_ENABLE_IPV6_DEFAULT

LAN_discovery.c:
- slight cleanup and comments for clarity

network.h:
- added ipany_ntoa()

network.c:
- added ipany_ntoa()
- fixed formatting
Possibly fixed LAN discovery on some configurations.
Possible bugs fixed, all received strings now force NULL terminate.
Removed useless code, possibly fixed something.
Fixed possible segfaults from bad input.
Fixed warnings and moved hex_string_to_bin to testing/
Fixed another thing in loop; added initialization for tox_array in lossless UDP.
Fixed several embarrassing errors and potential problems in tox_array.
Removed commented code and fixed broken functions for Lossless_UDP tox_array.

consistency check

fixed grammar to maintain consistency of output
Fixed segfault and added support for single quotes in toxic
Fixed DHT_test.c and added some checks.
Fixed issue 470, crypto_test still forcing libsodium when NaCL is chosen
Fixed segfault and removed deprecated code.
Properly fixed possible realloc with size zero problem.

Added dynamic memory allocation to crypto connections.

Also fixed some possible bugs in Messenger.c
Fixed loading and a small problem with the length of crypto requests.
Fixed function agruments according to new API
fixed calculation of messenger size (no spam was not accounted for)

Fixed spam problem. (I broke the API so this will not build)

The friend address is what the byte string that you give away for people
to add you will be called.

1. Every friend address now contains a number set by the friend. This is
to prevent someone from randomly spamming people in the DHT with friend
requests and makes it so you need the person to actually give you the
address in some way to send the friend request. This number is expected
to be encrypted with the friend request. All requests that do not
contain this number will be rejected. This means the spammer can no
longer use the DHT to collect lists of valid addresses to spam. It also
enables users to quickly change the number in case a spammer gets hold
of the address and starts spamming it.

2. A 2 byte checksum will be added (not implemented yet) to prevent
people from accidentally adding random strings as friends. (NOTE that
this has nothing to do with the spam problem I just decided to add a
placeholder for it now.)
Fixed m_sendmessage to return the ID of the message sent
Fixed a silly code ordering mistake
Moved a define and fixed another.
Fix bug where file handle wasn't closed on success
Fix bug where we could run past the end of the friends list
fixed print_statuschange & m_set_userstatus usage in nTox_win32.c
bug fix and added wrapping on friends list
Fix bug where friendreq_handlepacket did not do bounds checking
Fix bug where handle_NATping wouldn't perform bounds checking

Make test clients compatible with userstatus kinds
No features were added, just fixed callbacks.
Fixed 2 Null pointer derefrences in both nTox and toxic
Fixed a calloc getting freed before being used
toxic: Fixed doMessenger() interval.. Toxic is much faster and responsive now.
fixed bug that would cause this to always exit

various fixes for first time user
* added linking to libsodium
* fixed links to docs to point to wiki
fixed printing time stamp in toxic
Fixed a segfault when recieving text
Fixed the printing of a few strings, moved some code around.
changed some formatting, fixed the removal of x and y
cursor done better, fixed for chat windows
Fixed a bug with the minutes only being 1 character long when less than 10
Fix bug where memcpy could overrun buffer
Fixed a build error due to the removal of getnumfriends()
Fix bug where messages from yourself were preceeded by [-1]
nTox: fixed 2 possible crashes, 3 incorrect packet lengths
Fixed possible issues with the crypto reported by an anonymous person.
Fixed friends list and deleting friends. Automatically loads name/status from last time.
partially fixed friend add bug (key length test still broken)
partially fixed friend add bug (key length test still broken)
Fixed a bunch of bugs in TOXIC, added friendlist and more.
Fixed bugs, added friend listing (slightly buggy), and changed the general aesthetics

Removed unneeded include.
Fixed formatting and cleaned up output.

Fixed name related functions.

They now should give proper lengths and take length into account when
sending.

Added friend request accepting to nTox and fixed a bug.

Fixed a bug in Lossless UDP that prevented 2 clients from sometimes
connecting when they connected at the same time to each other.
[fixed]created new files misc_tools.(c|h) and moved hex_string_to_bin() there.

styling

haven't fixed switch statements because I'm lazy
Fixed the multiple friends request recieved at the same time problem.
Fixed comments in other files as per request of jvrv
The last fix was wrong, this time it's properly fixed.
Fixed bug that sometimes prevented two clients from connecting.
Fixed bug in the messenger loading.
Bug fixed, Loading and saving added to core.
Fixed some bugs and a regression.
Fixed useless inbound connection not timing out.
fixed the ncurses client i believe
Fixed 2 small mistakes present in the last pull request.
Fixed to be confilcts with the DHT and the messenger part.
Added a new test program. Fixed some stuff in Lossless UDP.
Fixed something in the DHT, added a milisecond time function.
Fixed a line in DHT.c and clarified something in DHT_test.c.

Fixed one possible bug in the DHT and added a basic TODO list.

Fixed a possible segfault which could have been cause by handling an
empty packet.

Fixed stuff, things work better now.

Client no longer responds to packets from itself.

DHT_test can now find the ip of one peer based on its client id.

Some stuff fixed.
DHT almost done, started testing. Fixed ADDR compiling problem. No more warnings with GCC and clang.

Added distance function and changed some stuff.

Also fixed typo in Readme.
